intro: Psacalium thyrsoideum, commonly known as the white thornapple, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and produces showy, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Psacalium thyrsoideum is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive flowers and unique appearance.
